ribbon.title: About Research Group
ribbon.description: The Computational Multiphysics Research Group (CoMPhys Lab) focuses on developing advanced computational models to study complex thermomechanical systems involving moving boundaries, multiphase interactions, and high strain-rate physics. Our research spans a broad range of applications—from bioinspired flight and cardiovascular flows to droplet evaporation, energetic material dynamics, and hypersonic reentry physics.

mission.description: At the core of our work lies a rigorous blend of first-principles modeling, high-fidelity numerical methods, and AI-accelerated multi-scale simulations. We seek to uncover governing physical mechanisms, design predictive frameworks, and provide insights into real-world engineering problems in aerospace, defense, energy, and biological systems.

vision.description: We actively collaborate across disciplines and welcome students and researchers eager to challenge themselves, develop meaningful tools, and contribute to high-impact science and engineering. The lab emphasizes research integrity, team learning, and best practices in software development, preparing members for both academic and industry leadership roles.

value.title: Excellence
value.description: We strive for the highest standards in research quality and scientific rigor.

value.title: Innovation
value.description: We push the boundaries of computational science with novel approaches and methods.

value.title: Collaboration
value.description: We believe in the power of interdisciplinary teamwork and global partnerships.

value.title: Education
value.description: We are committed to training the next generation of computational scientists.

about.title: Computational Multiphysics Research Lab
about.description: We model complex flows and materials across scales and speeds, combining physics-based simulation and AI to solve challenges in aerospace, defense, energy, and bioinspired systems.
